verses.verse: (For the choir director; with stringed instruments, upon an eight-stringed lyre.) (A Psalm of David.) O Lord,<WH3068> do not rebuke<WH3198> me in Thine anger,<WH639> Nor<WH408> chasten<WH3256> me in Thy wrath.<WH2534>
Be gracious<WH2603> to me, O Lord,<WH3068> for I [am] pining<WH536> away;<WH536> Heal<WH7495> me, O Lord,<WH3068> for my bones<WH6106> are dismayed.<WH926>
And my soul<WH5315> is greatly<WH3966> dismayed;<WH926> But Thou, O Lord<WH3068> â€“ how<WH4970> long<WH5704> <WH4970>?
Return,<WH7725> O Lord,<WH3068> rescue<WH2502> my soul;<WH5315> Save<WH3467> me because<WH4616> of Thy lovingkindness.<WH2617>
For there<WH369> is no<WH369> mention<WH2143> of Thee in death;<WH4194> In Sheol<WH7585> who<WH4310> will give<WH3034> Thee thanks<WH3034>?
I am weary<WH3021> with my sighing;<WH585> Every<WH3605> night<WH3915> I make my bed<WH4296> swim,<WH7811> I dissolve<WH4529> my couch<WH6210> with my tears.<WH1832>
My eye<WH5869> has wasted<WH6244> away<WH6244> with grief;<WH3708> It has become<WH6275> old<WH6275> because of all<WH3605> my adversaries.<WH6887>
Depart<WH5493> from me, all<WH3605> you who do<WH6466> iniquity,<WH205> For the Lord<WH3068> has heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of my weeping.<WH1065>
The Lord<WH3068> has heard<WH8085> my supplication,<WH8467> The Lord<WH3068> receives<WH3947> my prayer.<WH8605>
All<WH3605> my enemies<WH340> shall be ashamed<WH954> and greatly<WH3966> dismayed;<WH926> They shall turn<WH7725> back,<WH7725> they shall suddenly<WH7281> be ashamed.<WH954>
